title: Learning Design for Vector Addition Using a Reduced-Concreteness Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Basic algebraic operations and coordinate system comprehension
context.additional_context: A blended learning approach combining face-to-face instruction with online activities to provide a gradual learning experience, transitioning from physical manipulatives to abstract representations.

learning_goals: Learners can visually and manipulatively explain vector addition using physical vector models (concrete objects)
Learners can mathematically transform vector operations through semi-concrete representations (schematics) based on coordinate systems
Learners independently design procedures to solve vector addition problems using purely algebraic representations (abstract symbols)
Learners can explain conceptual connections between three representation stages (concrete-semi-concrete-abstract)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
